title: Check if your business is next to a designated or protected area

details.description: Find out if your business is in or near a designated or protected area and what environmental restrictions apply
details.body:
If your business is next to a designated or protected area there will be restrictions on what activities and developments you can do.

Designated or protected areas include:

  • national nature reserves
  • marine nature reserves
  • Sites of Special Scientific Interest (SSSIs)
  • Special Areas of Conservation (SACs)
  • Special Protection Areas (SPAs)
  • Ramsar sites

You can check the Natural England website for a full list of the types of designated and protected areas.

Search for protected areas

To check if your business is next to a protected area use:

  • the interactive map from Defra in England
  • the interactive map from the Countryside Council for Wales in Wales
  • the Scottish Natural Heritage SiteLink service in Scotland
  • the Northern Ireland Environment Agency website in Northern Ireland

If your business is next to a designated area

Contact your local council to find out what restrictions apply to your business.

You may need to:

  • get permission for your site from your local council
  • carry out an ecological survey, eg of local wildlife to find out if there are any protected species that might be affected by your business
  • carry out an Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA)
